trans-unit.source: Manages the print queues on a print server, which is usually a computer, but can be a dedicated hardware print server appliance.

When your program writes a value to a property of <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer>, that change has no effect until it is passed on to the computer that is represented by the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer> object.
To commit changes, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.Commit%2A> method for the object.
Similarly, other applications may change the actual print service properties of the computer.
To make sure that the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer> object for your program has the latest values, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.Refresh%2A> method for the object.
Classes within the <xref:System.Printing> namespace are not supported for use within a Windows service or ASP.NET application or service.
Attempting to use these classes from within one of these application types may produce unexpected problems, such as diminished service performance and run-time exceptions.
If you want to print from a Windows Forms application, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintServer"></xref> class.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintServer"></xref> class that represents the local print server and assigns it the specified <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemDesiredAccess"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer> will be initialized with the local print server's properties, such as <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.Name%2A>.
A value that specifies the type of print server access that your program needs.
desiredAccess is a value that can be applied only to a object, not a object.
For example, <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemDesiredAccess.UsePrinter"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintServer"></xref> class that has the specified path.
If `path` is `null`, the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer> will represent the local print server and will be initialized with its properties, such as <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.Name%2A>.
The name and complete path of the print server.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintServer"></xref> class by using the specified <xref href="System.Printing.PrintServerIndexedProperty"></xref> array to determine which properties will be initialized.
If `path` is `null`, the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer> will represent the local print server and will be initialized with its properties, such as <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.Name%2A>.
The complete path and name of the print server
The properties that the constructor initializes.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintServer"></xref> class that has the specified path and the needed access.
If `path` is `null`, the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer> will represent the local print server and will be initialized with its properties, such as <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.Name%2A>.
The name and complete path of the print server.
A value that specifies the type of print server access that your program needs.
desiredAccess is a value that can be applied only to a object, not a object.
For example, <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemDesiredAccess.UsePrinter"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintServer"></xref> class that has the specified path and properties filter.
If `path` is `null`, the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer> will represent the local print server and will be initialized with its properties, such as <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.Name%2A>.
The name and complete path of the print server.
An array of the names of properties that the constructor initializes.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintServer"></xref> class and provides the specified path, the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintServerIndexedProperty"></xref> array, and the needed access.
If `path` is `null`, the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer> will represent the local print server and will be initialized with its properties, such as <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.Name>.
The complete path and name of the print server
The properties that the constructor initializes.
A value that specifies the type of print server access that your program needs.
desiredAccess is a value that can be applied only to a object, not a object.
For example, <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemDesiredAccess.UsePrinter"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintServer"></xref> class that has the specified path, properties filter, and the needed access.
If `path` is `null`, the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer> will represent the local print server and will be initialized with its properties, such as <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.Name%2A>.
The name and complete path of the print server.
An array of the names of properties that the constructor initializes.
A value that specifies the type of print server access that your program needs.
desiredAccess is a value that can be applied only to a object, not a object.
For example, <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemDesiredAccess.UsePrinter"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the print server beeps in response to an error condition in the printer.
<xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> `true` if the print server beeps in response to an error; otherwise, `false`.
Commits any changes that your program made to the properties of the print server object by writing them to the print server that the object represents.
The method requires that the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer> object be created with <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemDesiredAccess.AdministrateServer> rights.
Some of the properties are not committed.
Some of the properties could not be committed.
\- or -
The <xref href="System.Printing.PrintServer"></xref> object was not created with sufficient rights.
Do not use.
The thread priority.
Do not use.
The default scheduler thread priority.
Gets or sets the path where the print server's spool files are located.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that identifies the complete path of the folder for the spool files.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref> from the print server.
The queue that is deleted.
`true` if the queue is successfully deleted; otherwise, `false`.
Removes the print queue with the specified name from the print server.
The name of the queue that is deleted.
`true` if the queue is successfully deleted; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the type of events that the print server logs.
A value of <xref href="System.Printing.PrintServerEventLoggingTypes"></xref> that identifies the type of event logging that is provided by the print server.
The default is <xref href="System.Printing.PrintServerEventLoggingTypes.LogPrintingErrorEvents"></xref>.
Obtains a reference to the named print queue from the print server.
The name of the print queue.
The <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref> with the specified name from the print server.
Gets a specified print queue from the print server.
The name of the print queue.
The names of the properties that are initialized in the returned queue.
The <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref> with the specified name from the print server.
Gets the collection of print queues, which are of the specified <xref href="System.Printing.EnumeratedPrintQueueTypes"></xref> and are initialized only in the specified properties.
The names of the queue properties that are initialized.
An array of values that represent the types of print queues that are returned in the collection.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueCollection"></xref> of print queues of the specified types; each print queue has only the specified properties initialized.
Gets a collection of print queues of the specified types.
These print queues are only initialized in the properties that are specified in the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueIndexedProperty"></xref> array.
The queues in the collection are only initialized in the properties that are listed in the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueIndexedProperty> array.
The properties that the constructor initializes.
An array of values that represent the types of print queues in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueCollection"></xref> of the print server.
Gets a collection of print queues that are hosted by the print server and that are initialized only in the specified properties.
The names of the queue properties that are initialized.
The of print queues on the print server; each print queue is initialized only in the properties that are specified in propertiesFilter.
Gets the collection of print queues of the specified types that are named in <xref href="System.Printing.EnumeratedPrintQueueTypes"></xref> and hosted by the print server.
An array of values that represent the types of print queues that are in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueCollection"></xref> of print queues, of the specified types, on the print server.
Gets the collection of print queues that the print server hosts.
The <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueCollection"></xref> of print queues on the print server.

Gets a collection of print queues that are hosted by the print server and initialized only in the properties that are specified in the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueIndexedProperty"></xref> array.
The properties that the constructor initializes.
A whose members are initialized only in the properties specified by propertiesFilter.
Installs a print queue, and associated printer driver, on the print server.
The name of the new queue.
The path and name of the printer driver.
The IDs of the ports that the new queue uses.
The name of the print processor.
The parameters that are initialized.
The new <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
Installs a print queue, and associated printer driver, on the print server.
The name of the new queue.
The path and name of the printer driver.
The IDs of the ports that the new queue uses.
The name of the print processor.
The attributes, as flags, of the new queue.
The newly created <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
Installs a prioritized print queue, and associated printer driver, on the print server.

Use the `printQueueProperty` parameter to initialize one, and only one, of the queue's <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.ShareName%2A>, <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.Comment%2A>, or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.Location%2A> properties.

If you want to initialize more than one, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.InstallPrintQueue%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%5B%5D%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Printing.PrintQueueAttributes%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Int32%29> overload of this method.
The name of the new queue.
The path and name of the printer driver.
The IDs of the ports that the new queue uses.
The name of the print processor.
The attributes, as flags, of the new queue.
The comment, location, or share name of the new queue.
A value from 1 through 99 that specifies the priority of this print queue relative to other queues that are hosted by the print server.
A value from 1 to 99 that specifies the default priority of print jobs that are sent to the queue.
The newly created <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
Installs a shared, prioritized print queue, and associated printer driver, on the print server.

If you do not want to initialize all three of the queue's <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.ShareName%2A>, <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.Comment%2A>, or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.Location%2A> properties; you can pass an empty string for one or more of `printQueueShareName`, `printQueueComment`, and `printQueueLocation`.

If you want to initialize just one of these properties, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.InstallPrintQueue%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%5B%5D%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Printing.PrintQueueAttributes%2CSystem.Printing.PrintQueueStringProperty%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Int32%29> overload of this method.
The name of the new queue.
The path and name of the printer driver.
The IDs of the ports that the new queue uses.
The name of the print processor.
The attributes, as flags, of the new queue.
The share name of the new queue.
A comment about the queue that is visible to users in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_win](~/includes/tlasharptla-win-md.md)] UI.
The location of the new queue.
The path of a file that is inserted at the beginning of each print job.
A value from 1 through 99 that specifies the priority of the queue relative to other queues that are hosted by the print server.
A value from 1 through 99 that specifies the default priority of new print jobs that are sent to the queue.
The newly created <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
Releases the unmanaged resources that are used by the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintServer"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether initialization of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintServer"></xref> properties has been postponed.
`true` if initialization is postponed; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the major version of the operating system.

The versions of Windows on which [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winfx](~/includes/tlasharptla-winfx-md.md)] can be run have the following major (right of the decimal) and minor (left of the decimal) version numbers:
[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winxp](~/includes/tlasharptla-winxp-md.md)]: 5.1
[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winnetsvrfam](~/includes/tlasharptla-winnetsvrfam-md.md)]: 5.2
[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winvista](~/includes/tlasharptla-winvista-md.md)]: 6.0
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> that identifies the major version of the operating system.
Gets the minor version within the major version of the operating system.

The versions of Windows on which [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winfx](~/includes/tlasharptla-winfx-md.md)] can be run have the following major (right of the decimal) and minor (left of the decimal) version numbers:
[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winxp](~/includes/tlasharptla-winxp-md.md)]: 5.1
[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winnetsvrfam](~/includes/tlasharptla-winnetsvrfam-md.md)]: 5.2
[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winvista](~/includes/tlasharptla-winvista-md.md)]: 6.0
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> that identifies the minor version of the operating system.
Gets the name of the print server.
The name of the print server.
The property is not initialized.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether notifications that a print job has finished are sent to either the print server or the client computer.
`true` if notifications are sent to the client computer; `false` if notifications are sent to the print server.
Gets or sets the thread priority for the process that manages I/O through the printer ports.
The port thread for the server reads the spool file, processes the data, and sends the data to a port monitor, which then sends the data to the printer.
A <xref href="System.Threading.ThreadPriority"></xref> enumeration value that identifies the thread priority for the process that manages the printer ports.
The default is <xref href="System.Threading.ThreadPriority.Normal"></xref>.

Updates the properties of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintServer"></xref> object so that each property value matches the corresponding attribute value of the print server that the object represents.
Any changes that you make to the properties of a <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer> can be lost when the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.Refresh%2A> method executes.
This loss occurs if you did not yet write the changes to the print server that the object represents with <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.Commit%2A>.
Some of the properties cannot be refreshed.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether users can restart jobs after an error occurs if printer pooling is enabled.
A calling program must have administrative permissions to set this value.
`true` if jobs can be restarted when printer pooling is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates the wait time before a job can be restarted, if an error occurs when printer pooling is also enabled.
A calling program must have administrative permissions to set this value.
The wait time, in minutes, before a job restarts.
Gets or sets the thread priority for the process that routes print jobs from applications to print queues.
A <xref href="System.Threading.ThreadPriority"></xref> enumeration value that identifies the thread priority for the print server scheduling process.
The default is <xref href="System.Threading.ThreadPriority.Normal"></xref>.
Gets the version of the print spooler system.
In practice, the value of this property is always the same as the value of <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.MajorVersion%2A> except that the latter is a type <xref:System.Int32>.

The versions of Windows on which [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winfx](~/includes/tlasharptla-winfx-md.md)] can be run have the following major (right of the decimal) and minor (left of the decimal) version numbers:
[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winxp](~/includes/tlasharptla-winxp-md.md)]: 5.1
[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winnetsvrfam](~/includes/tlasharptla-winnetsvrfam-md.md)]: 5.2
[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winvista](~/includes/tlasharptla-winvista-md.md)]: 6.0
A <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that identifies the version of the print spooler system.
